t: For the choir director. A song of the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.
God*pn is our refuge and strength, a*ln helper who is always found in*ln times of trouble.
Therefore*ln we will not be afraid, though*ln the earth trembles and*ln the mountains topple into*ln the depths of the seas,
though*ln its water roars and foams and*ln the mountains quake with its turmoil. Selah*ig
There*pn is a river — its*ln streams delight the city of God, the*ln holy dwelling place of the Most High.
God*ln is within her; she will not be toppled. God*ln will help her when the morning dawns.
Nations*ln rage, kingdoms topple; the*ln earth melts when he lifts his voice.
The*ln Lord*s of Armies is with us; the*ln God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah*ig
Come,*pn see the works of the Lord,*s who*ln brings devastation on the earth.
He*ln makes wars cease throughout the earth. He*ln shatters bows and cuts spears to pieces; he*ln sets wagons ablaze.
“Stop*ln fighting, and know that I am God, exalted*ln among the nations, exalted on the earth.”
The*ln Lord*s of Armies is with us; the*ln God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah*ig
